data.title: Modern Family
data.meta_description: "I'm a cool dad, that's my thang."  - Phil Dunphy
data.text:
Life Outside of Modern Family

I can imagine that all of the stars of Modern Family are slammed with working on this successful show, but they still find time to be a part of other things going on in the business.

Sofia Vergara, who plays Gloria on Modern Family, has recently received a lot of press for lending her voice to the movie Happy Feet 2. Vergara’s character is a a “South American, hot Latina penguin with an accent” which is right up her alley. She claimed in an interview that “she had to do no research to get into that character”. Here is the link to the interview : http://www.movies.ie/Interviews/Sofia_Vergara__Video_Interview_for_Happy_Feet_2

Vergara also recently was in the The Smurfs movie, and is going to also be starring in New Years Eve. Below is an interview of Vergara discussing The Smurfs movie.

Sofia Vergara also is going to be starring in The Three Stooges movie that is coming out in 2012. She will play a character named Lydia, where she will ” play a devious woman who pretends to be the wife of a dying man and tells the Stooges she’ll pay them a handsome sum if they kill the man in his sleep.”

Another member of the Modern Family cast that has been finding time to film some movie roles is Sarah Hyland. Hyland plays Haley Dunphy on Modern Family. Her imdb (internet movie database) shows that she will be in three movies set to come out in 2012. One of the movies is Gay Dude, which is described as “two guys who make a pact to lose their virginity before prom and find their friendship tested when one of them comes out of the closet.” Another movie she is set to star in is a movie called Struck By Lightning where she will play a character named Claire Matthews. Lastly, Hyland is set to appear in a movie entitled April Apocalypse.

Young star, Nolan Gould, who plays Luke Dunphy on Modern Family is another cast member that is set to appear in a movie that comes out in 2012. He will be a part of the movie The To Do List. He will play a character named Max, and will work alongside actors such as, Rachel Bilson, Connie Britton, and Andy Samberg.

All of the actors in Modern Family are wildly talented, and I’m sure we will be seeing a lot more of them in the future!

Analysis of “Run For Your Wife”

In the episode “Run For Your Wife”, it is the first day of school for all the kids. Phil believes that the first day of school is hard on Claire when in actuality she is excited because she can finally have time for herself to read a book. Phil decides to get off work early to spend time with Claire so she doesn’t have to be alone. This quickly turns into a contest between Claire and Phil on who can run the fastest. After much hesitation, Claire finally gives in and agrees to race Phil.

Gloria is reminiscing on how fast Manny has grown up when he walks down the stairs wearing a colorful poncho. Jay suggests he takes it off before going into the school, and so he does. Later, Gloria finds the poncho and confronts Jay about making Manny take it off. They decide to take the poncho to Manny at school.

Cameron and Mitchell are arguing about Cam always dressing Lily up as famous people and taking pictures of her. Mitchell thinks this is over the top, and Cam thinks that Mitchell should loosen up. Cam persuades Mitchell to dance with Lily, and he ends up hitting her head on the door frame. The two of them freak out, and rush Lily to the doctor. Afterwards, Cam and Mitchell put Lily in the car and accidentally press lock. Cam is panicking, and Mitchell ends up calling Emergency Assistance and they unlock the car for them

Scene 1- Claire is in the kitchen getting everything ready for the first day of school, and Luke runs in panicked. He forgot to keep a journal all summer for his class. A plot.

Scene 2- Claire and Phil interview. Phil discusses the difficulties of getting everyone ready for the first day of school. A plot.

Scene 3- Back to Claire in the kitchen. Alex comes in carrying a bunch of things, Phil offers to help her. The audience then sees that Phil only has on boxers. Haley then enters the kitchen, and a discussion about where her driving instructor is going to pick her up ensues. A plot.

Scene 4- Claire and Phil interview. Discussing taking turns riding with Haley. D plot.

Scene 5- Haley is driving with Claire, and getting frustrated by Claire telling her what to do. D plot.

Scene 6- Cuts to a time when Haley was driving with Phil and they end up in a park. D plot.

Scene 7- Gloria is reminiscing on how fast Manny is growing up. Manny walks down the stairs wearing a poncho ready for school. Jay gives Manny a hard time for wearing the poncho. B plot.

Scene 8- Mitchell is baby proofing he and Cameron’s house when he notices that Cameron has dressed Lily up as Diana Ross and is taking pictures of her. C plot.

Scene 9- Cameron and Mitchell interview. Cameron discusses all of the people he has dressed Lily up as, and shows photos of her dressed as them. C plot.

Scene 10- Cameron instructs Mitchell to loosen up, and dance with their daughter. Mitchell starts to sway a little bit, then finally dances with her and bonks her head on the door jamb. C plot.

End of Act I

Scene 11- Cameron places a cold pack on Lily’s head, and Mitchell tries to make Lily laugh. They decide to call Claire to ask her advice on what to do about Lily. C plot.

Scene 12- Claire is making herself a cup of tea when the phone rings. Claire explains to Mitchell that Luke used to hit his head all the time and he is fine. After Claire says this, Mitchell decides they should take Lily to the doctor. C plot.

Scene 13- Phil interview. Phil discusses how the first day of school is hard for stay-at-home mom’s. A plot.

Scene 14- Shot of Claire curling up on the couch reading her book and drinking tea. A plot.

Scene 15- Phil interview resumes. Phil claims that if you listen to women they will tell you exactly what they want. A plot.

Scene 16- Claire is sitting on the couch in the living room reading when Phil enters the room. Phil reads over Claire’s shoulder and notices that her book has a map at the beginning. Phil explains he rescheduled his meeting to keep Claire company. Claire explains she is fine she just wants to read and maybe go for a run later. Phil exclaims he wants to go for a run with her. A plot.

Scene 17- Phil interview. Phil stares at the camera for a while, and then cocks his head and says “listening”. A plot.

Scene 18- Back to Claire and Phil in the living room. Claire explains she kind of likes to run alone and she runs pretty fast, and is not sure if Phil can keep up. Phil reminds Claire that he power walks with his poles everyday. A plot.

Scene 19- Shot of Phil walking with his poles and a voiceover of him explaining that he wears shoes that were designed by doctors. A plot.

Scene 20- Back to Claire and Phil in the living room. Argument continues about who can run faster. A plot.

Scene 21- Phil interview. Phil explains that the day changed during their argument, and it was “game on”. A plot.

Scene 22- Claire interview. Claire claims all she wants to do is read. A plot.

Scene 23- Jay comes down the stairs ready for work, and Gloria is holding the poncho that Manny had on that morning. Jay tries to explain that Manny decided to take it off on the way to school, and he had nothing to do with it. B plot.

Scene 24- Jay interview. Explains that he went through this with Mitchell when he was a kid. Mitchell used to dance to his own beat wearing a “jaunty scarf”. B plot.

Scene 25- Back to Jay and Gloria. They argue about Jay persuading Manny to take off the poncho, and gloria insists that they go to the school to give Manny his poncho. B plot.

Scene 26- Claire is in the Dunphy’s kitchen. Phil pops in and they continue to discuss racing each other. Claire gives in and agrees to race Phil. A plot.

Scene 27- Cameron and Mitchell are at the Pediatrician’s office. The doctor is Asian and takes a look at Lily. Cameron keeps interrupting her to describe what she was wearing, and explains that they have hung Asian art. Mitchell interjects still worried about Lily and explains that she hasn’t laughed. The doctor gets Mitchell to demonstrate how hard Lily hit her head. Mitchell rams his head into the wall a couple times, and the doctor explains that Lily is fine. C plot.

End of Act II

Scene 28- Jay and Gloria are walking down the hall carrying Manny’s poncho. They run into Luke and Jay continues to talk to him and writes him a note for not doing his journal if he will stick up for Manny once he gets the poncho. During this time Gloria goes to find Manny’s classroom. Jay meets Gloria at the door, and they hand Manny his poncho. Manny reaches into the poncho’s pocket and pulls out a South American pan flute. Gloria then whispers to Jay to break the flute, and so he does. B plot.

Scene 29- Cameron and Mitchell are in the parking lot to the pediatrician’s office and load Lily into the car, they have a sentimental moment and are complimenting one another when they accidentally lock the keys in the car. They begin to panic a little. C plot.

Scene 30- Claire and Phil are in the front yard preparing for the run. Alex and Luke arrive home and see their parents. Phil explains to them that they are going to race. The race begins. A plot.

Scene 31- Cameron and Mitchell are still in the parking lot. Cameron is threatening to break a window to get Lily out. Mitchell calmly calls Emergency Assistance, and they are able to unlock the car. C plot.

Scene 32- Claire and Phil are mid-race and Claire is winning easily. She looks back and notices Phil’s shirt. A plot.

Scene 33- Claire interview. Explains that she runs five miles a day. She would never lose a race to Phil, but after she saw Phil’s face when the kids came home and Phil’s shirt that read, “World’s Greatest Dad” she realized that the first day of school is hard on Phil. A plot.

Scene 34- Claire is ahead of Phil, but after a glance over her shoulder she lets Phil pass her. A plot.

Scene 35- Phil makes it back to the Dunphy’s front yard and starts to celebrate when he is hit by a driver’s education car. A/D plot.

Scene 36A- Claire interview. Explains she lost the race to cheer Phil up.

Scene 36B- Shot of Jay and Gloria watching Manny do his pan flute dance wearing his poncho. Claire voiceover.

Scene 36C- Shot of Mitchell watching Lily sleep. Claire voiceover continues.

Scene 36D- Claire interview. Finishes up voiceover.

End of Act III

Scene 37- Claire is standing in front of the refrigerator, Phil comes up behind her and suggests their family go get pizza. Claire explains she is gross and just wants to read her book. Phil states, “Oh that cool book with the map? How fast do you think you can read that?”

End of Show

There were about 20 scenes for the A plot (a lot of short little interviews that fall under the A plot),

6 scenes for the B plot,

9 scenes for the C plot,

and 4 scenes for the D plot.

I loved this episode, I thought the writers did a good job and I thought it was hilarious!
